main event: On May 21, 1955, at Norton AFB, California, three spherical objects were observed, initially appearing as silver, then disappearing and becoming visible again, accompanied by a short conical vapor trail before climbing out of sight within 30-45 seconds.
interesting points: The observation was made by military personnel and lasted for 30-45 seconds.
The objects were described as initially appearing as silver, then disappearing, and becoming visible again with a short conical vapor trail.
Possible reflection from the moon on aircraft was considered as a likely explanation for the sighting.
The objects were observed to pulsate brightly, increasing in apparent size and then becoming smaller.
The report includes information on the observers' credentials, indicating that they were considered very reliable.
